#Text=UK naval crew describe their capture and detention by Iran
#Text=Friday , April 6 , 2007
#Text=At a press conference held Friday at the Royal Marine Base Chivenor in Devon , first-hand details of the fifteen UK Royal Navy crew 's capture and detention by Iran were revealed .
#Text=The fifteen navy crew , eight from the Royal Navy ( RN ) and seven from the Royal Marines ( RM ) , arrived by helicopter at the base on Thursday .
#Text=Following a period of debriefing and rest , the crew spoke at a press conference on Friday .
#Text=Captain Christopher Air , RM , and Lieutenant Felix Carman , RN , spoke for the group .
#Text=Carman and Air thanked the staff of the British Embassy in Tehran , the Foreign Office , and Ministry of Defence for securing their release .

#Text=In addition , Air stated that the crew " would like to thank the very many members of the Royal Navy and Royal Marines who have been working so hard over the last 2 weeks supporting our families and friends and for arranging our return to here . "

column1: #Text=Carman provided details of the navigational equipment and hand held GPS used by the UK crew .
#Text=A support helicopter also provided continuous navigational confirmation .
#Text=The boarding crew were linked electronically to HMS Cornwall , which monitored the crew 's position continually .
#Text=" Let me make it absolutely clear , " said Carman .

#Text=" Irrespective of what has been said in the past , when we were detained by the IRG we were inside internationally recognised Iraqi territorial waters and I can clearly state we were 1.7 nautical miles from Iranian waters . "
#Text=Let me be absolutely clear , from the outset it was very apparent that fighting back was simply not an option — Captain Christopher Air , Royal Marines
#Text=Having boarded an unidentified merchant vessel in the Shatt Al Arab waterway , the crew were stopped by two Iranian boats , which prevented them from leaving .
#Text=" When we tried to leave , they prevented us by blocking us in , " explained Air .
#Text=" By now it was becoming increasingly clear that they had arrived with a planned intent .

#Text=They rammed our boat and trained their heavy machine guns , RPGs and weapons on us .

_	_	_	_

#Text=We made a conscious decision to not engage the Iranians and do as they asked ,  said Air .

#Text= They boarded our boats , removed our weapons and steered the boats towards the Iranian shore . "

column1: #Text=On arrival at an Iranian naval base , the UK crew were stripped of their gear , blindfolded , and led to an interrogation room .
#Text=The following morning the group was flown to Tehran and transported to a prison where they faced " constant psychological pressure . "
#Text=The crew were stripped and dressed in pajamas .
#Text=According to Carman , " the next few nights were spent in stone cells , approximately 8'x 6 ' , sleeping on piles of blankets .

#Text=They were interrogated most nights and offered two options .

#Text= If we admitted we had strayed , we would be on a plane back to the UK soon , " said Carman .

column1: #Text=" If we did n't we faced up to seven years in prison . "
#Text=The crew were kept in isolation until the last few nights , when they were allowed to gather together for a couple of hours at a time .
#Text=On the subject of deciding to resist the Iranians or not , Air was adamant that it would have made the situation worse .
#Text=" Let me be absolutely clear , from the outset it was very apparent that fighting back was simply not an option , " said Air .
#Text=" Had we chosen to do so then many of us would not be standing here today . "
